intro: Glochidion anfractuosum, commonly known as the zigzag hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its distinctive zigzagging stems. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Glochidion anfractuosum is often found in moist, tropical environments and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
